help.subtitle: Find answers to common questions, contact support, and access user guides

questions.newBirth: How do I register a new birth?
questions.documents: What documents are required for birth registration?
questions.certificate: How can I generate a birth certificate?
questions.edit: Can I edit a registration after it's been submitted?
questions.password: How do I change my password?
questions.forgotPassword: What should I do if I forget my password?
questions.language: How do I change the system language?
questions.roles: What are the different user roles in the system?

answers.newBirth: To register a new birth, navigate to the 'New Registration' page from the main menu. Fill in all required information including child details, parent information, and birth location. Make sure you have all necessary documents ready.
answers.documents: You typically need the hospital birth certificate, parents' identification documents, marriage certificate (if applicable), and any other supporting documents as required by your region's regulations.
answers.certificate: Go to the 'Certificates' section and select 'Generate Certificate'. Choose the registration record and select the certificate type. The system will generate a PDF certificate that you can download and print.
answers.edit: Yes, if you have registrar privileges, you can edit registrations by going to the 'Registrations' page and clicking the edit button next to the record you want to modify.
answers.password: Go to your Profile settings and look for the 'Change Password' section. You'll need to enter your current password and then your new password twice for confirmation.
answers.forgotPassword: On the login page, click 'Forgot Password?' and enter your email address. You'll receive instructions to reset your password via email.
answers.language: Click on your profile dropdown in the top right corner and select your preferred language from the language menu. The system supports English, Twi, Ga, and Ewe.
answers.roles: There are three main roles: Viewer (can view registrations and generate certificates), Registrar (can create and edit registrations), and Admin (full system access including user management and settings).
